key_insight: Applying Nesterov-style momentum to ray-direction search (ARS-OPT) accelerates convergence for hard-label black-box attacks, substantially reducing the number of model queries needed to find minimum ℓ2 adversarial perturbations.
problem_solved: Reduces the prohibitive query complexity of hard-label black-box attacks by improving the optimization of ray directions that yield minimal ℓ2 perturbations.
method: Formulate the attack as a ray-direction optimization: for each candidate direction, perform a line search to find the smallest ℓ2 perturbation that flips the top-1 label.
Introduce momentum (Nesterov-inspired) updates on the ray direction (ARS-OPT) to accelerate directional convergence and avoid slow zig-zagging in the search space.
Combine momentum-driven direction updates with query-efficient line-search steps so fewer label queries are required per optimization iteration.
impact: Enables much more query-efficient evaluation of model robustness under hard-label constraints, making black-box attack experiments faster and more practical for both attackers and defenders assessing worst-case behavior.
visual_elements: Schematic: ray from original image through candidate directions showing minimal ℓ2 perturbation at the decision boundary
Line chart: queries vs. attack success / perturbation size comparing ARS-OPT to baseline methods (steeper convergence for ARS-OPT)

paper_title: Improving the Convergence Rate of Ray Search Optimization for Query-Efficient Hard-Label Attacks
paper_authors: Xinjie Xu, Shuyu Cheng, Dongwei Xu, Qi Xuan, Chen Ma
